elements.contents:
AI Boom/Bubble Monitor

    • Dashboard
    • News
    • Methodology
    • Background
    • Disclosures

    Boom or bubble newsfeed

    Showing 50 of 125 stories

    DateIndicatorImpactStory
    Dec 4, 2025Revenue momentum
    Worsen
    Microsoft cut Foundry growth targets to ~25%
    Dec 4, 2025Industry strain
    Worsen
    PJM capacity payments jumped to $14.7bn, with data centers driving $7.3–$9.3bn incremental costs.
    Dec 4, 2025Industry strain
    Worsen
    WoodMac sees a 304kt 2025 copper shortfall; AI data centers use 27–33t per MW.
    Dec 4, 2025Funding quality
    Worsen
    Anthropic's Amodei warns AI players risk overextension amid uncertain payback timing and 'YOLO' spending.
    Dec 3, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Stable
    Coatue shows ChatGPT's 16% Thanksgiving dip is seasonal; YoY visits +14M, not Gemini loss.
    Dec 3, 2025Funding quality
    Worsen
    JPM says 65–90% of VC returns unmonetized; private credit swelled to $2.5tn.
    Dec 3, 2025Revenue momentum
    Stable
    The Information survey: 80% daily AI use, 88% research-focused; complex agent adoption limited.
    Dec 3, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Anthropic says Claude Code annualized revenue hit $1B; acquiring Bun for low-hundreds-of-millions.
    Dec 3, 2025Industry strain
    Improve
    Google plans >5M TPUs by 2027; Meta evaluating TPUs, adding supply diversity versus Nvidia.
    Dec 2, 2025Revenue momentum
    Worsen
    OpenAI's ChatGPT 7-day visits fell 203M to 191M (-6%) after Google's Gemini 3 Pro launch.
    Dec 2, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    ElevenLabs posted $193M revenue and $116M net profit, validating AI product demand and pricing.
    Dec 2, 2025Industry strain
    Worsen
    US startups switch to Alibaba Qwen to save ~$1,000 per user, pressuring closed-model revenues.
    Dec 2, 2025 Industry strain
    Worsen
    DeepSeek-V3.2 claims GPT-5/Gemini-3 parity, likely intensifying price competition while AI capex remains elevated.
    Dec 2, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Vercel replaced 10-person sales team with one engineer/AI, cutting costs 99% while maintaining output​.
    Dec 2, 2025Revenue momentum
    Worsen
    OpenAI delays ad network and declares "code red" due to rising competition​.
    Dec 1, 2025Economic strain
    Worsen
    Coatue flags AI power demand could grow 10x, highlighting worsening grid bottlenecks for hyperscalers.
    Dec 1, 2025 Funding quality
    Worsen
    OpenAI’s $1.4tn eight‑year compute plan, reportedly debt‑financed, raises fragility versus Google’s TPU-integrated stack.
    Dec 1, 2025 Funding quality
    Worsen
    Oracle’s OpenAI exposure hits 58% backlog; capex seen $80bn/year by 2029; CDS at three‑year high.
    Nov 29, 2025Industry strain
    Worsen
    Sub-50% GPU utilization and billions/month GPU buys imply underused capex at OpenAI/Microsoft/Oracle.
    Nov 27, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Top 100 GenAI products traffic grew 8% YoY to 2​.1B visits; long-tail expanding​.
    Nov 27, 2025Industry strain
    Improve
    New marketplace provides liquidity for locked-in compute contracts, mitigating risk of idle capacity​.
    Nov 27, 2025Industry strain
    Worsen
    Vulnerability in Google's agent allows data exfiltration, highlighting security risks in agentic workflows​.
    Nov 26, 2025Funding quality
    Improve
    Nvidia reports 98% FCF-to-net income since FY18 and DSO 53 days, dismissing vendor financing.
    Nov 26, 2025 Economic strain
    Worsen
    Google says it must double compute capacity every six months, signaling surging AI capex.
    Nov 26, 2025 Industry strain
    Improve
    Google's TPUv7 claims 100% better perf/watt and 1.4x perf/$ vs GPUs, lowering AI capex.
    Nov 26, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    OpenEvidence reached 301,900 prescribers in 11 months (+86% QoQ), outpacing Doximity's 11-year benchmark.
    Nov 26, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    ByteDance 30T tokens/day and >2,000 Q3 AI tenders (~¥10B) signal strengthening demand.
    Nov 26, 2025 Industry strain
    Worsen
    Ex-Oracle says AWS, Azure, Google AI GPU capex unprofitable; breakeven in 2–3 years.
    Nov 26, 2025 Industry strain
    Improve
    Gemini 3 cut tokens ~35% in AlphaSense tests while improving quality, easing inference costs.
    Nov 26, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Booking.com AI agent handles tens of thousands messages daily; pilots lifted satisfaction 70%, signaling adoption.
    Nov 25, 2025 Economic strain
    Improve
    Anthropic projects 1.8% annual US productivity boost from AI, potentially easing economy-wide AI capex strain.
    Nov 25, 2025 Economic strain
    Improve
    Anthropic estimates 80% task time savings across jobs, supporting productivity gains offsetting AI buildout risks.
    Nov 25, 2025Funding quality
    Improve
    White House EO (Nov 24, 2025) launches Genesis Mission using DOE lab datasets, anchoring AI funding.
    Nov 25, 2025Funding quality
    Stable
    NVIDIA reports DSO 52 days, 73.4% GAAP gross margin, and disclosed SPE guarantees, easing financing concerns.
    Nov 25, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    European Commission delays AI Act to Dec‑2027 and eases anonymized data use, aiding Google/Meta/OpenAI.
    Nov 25, 2025 Economic strain
    Worsen
    Amazon’s 2.6 GW gas plant to power 2.4 GW data centers exceeds Indiana residential demand.
    Nov 25, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    AI coding revenues exceed $3.1B; Anysphere ARR >$1B, Cognition ~$400M, confirming rapid demand.
    Nov 24, 2025Industry strain
    Improve
    Alphabet, Microsoft report 13-17% token CMGR vs 9-12% needed, though growth decelerating.
    Nov 21, 2025Funding quality
    Worsen
    Analysts project OpenAI's compute spend peaks at $111B in 2028, requiring substantial external financing.
    Nov 20, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    EU proposes easing GDPR/AI Act—data sharing, delayed high‑risk rules—reducing AI compliance friction.
    Nov 20, 2025Funding quality
    Improve
    Hugging Face retains ~$200m of $400m raise, signaling disciplined funding versus peers' heavy spend.
    Nov 20, 2025Funding quality
    Worsen
    McKinsey: neocloud BMaaS yields 14–16% gross profit, >80% utilization needs, hyperscaler-concentrated revenues, worsening funding resilience.
    Nov 19, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Nvidia posted a revenue beat and strong outlook; 62% of S&P 500 mention AI.
    Nov 19, 2025Industry strain
    Improve
    Google trained Gemini 3 Pro on in-house TPUs, reducing single-vendor dependence on Nvidia hardware.
    Nov 19, 2025Economic strain
    Worsen
    Microsoft/Nvidia $15B into Anthropic plus $30B Azure spend, 1GW capacity implies ~$50B AI capex.
    Nov 19, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Baidu disclosed Q3 AI revenue up 50% to ¥10B; AI cloud +33%, marketing +262%.
    Nov 18, 2025 Economic strain
    Improve
    EpochAI shows trillion‑dollar compute cluster delayed to 2035, implying slower AI capex ramp.
    Nov 18, 2025Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Sam Altman cites OpenAI's 300x cost drop (o3-preview $200 -> GPT-5.1 $0.674), supporting adoption.
    Nov 18, 2025 Revenue momentum
    Improve
    Google's Gemini 3 Pro shows 100% AIME, 81% MMMU-Pro, with claimed lower prices, potentially boosting demand.
    Nov 17, 2025Economic strain
    Worsen
    Bridgewater: tech capex adds ~0.9pp of 2.0% US GDP growth by Q2’25, concentrating exposure.

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
